definition: man's family (in marriage)
male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]

sentences.english: In China, the wedding is generally hosted by the groom's family.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，婚礼一般都是由男家来操办。

definition: bride's family (in marriage)
go-between/matchmaker
to marry off a daughter
to thank the matchmaker
husband's family
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage
betrothal gift/bride price
betrothal gift
first return of bride to her parental home
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
dowry/to give as a dowry/to accompany sb
variant of 訂婚|订婚[ding4 hun1]
to pay bride-price (payment to the bride's family in former times)
(of the groom's family) to send a bridal sedan chair 花轎|花轿 to fetch the bride/to send a party to escort the bride to the groom's house
betrothal money (given to the bride's family)
to take a wife
